TopicTitle: WMCC - Share your Probe before Pilot Approaches

Articles.Content:
Stock Parts

It appears that all it takes to open a new space start-up is some spare parts and a catchy name. Kerbal News Right Then is on site (in the bushes) as the newest Space Agency is about to come on line with a series of test launches. First launch in the lines up is the Lil' Sounder *15Km* Test Probe (According to our internal sources within the infantile agency).



Kefarious Enterprises (According to the Big Sign on the Building) has put out a mission statement that it will focus on a Probes before Pilot approach. This novel new idea seems to have garnered some attention as there is quite the turn out we can see from the Bushes. Whoever this shadowy group of investors may be, they have stepped up onto the world stage. While agencies claim that the cost of a Spacecraft is rather substantial to place in the digital hands of snippets of code, Kefarious Enterprises seems to be adopting the approach with vigor.


The Lil Sounder is a Vessel Made from Stock Parts playing with the WMCC Mod. The parts used are the first science unlock for the tech tree that the Mod uses.
It is capable of completing the First Mission but is a bit touchy on the steering, If it is difficulty to keep it pointed the way you want, adjust the Gimbal on the Engines in the VAB.

Craft Link
KSP Builds - Lil Sounder_S1

Edited January 23 by Fizzlebop Smith
Pic

Arc_Lite Lander Probe Series Lander_S1

After a week of near continuous launches, Kefarious Enterprises has declared it that will not be left out of the prestige. Unveiling their beast of an 8 stage monster the Arc Lite Lander Probe Series Lander, they will soon take pikt-yours of the Infamous Munar Arches with nary a Kerbal In sight. Consolidated Kerbal States says there are no other Kerbals around because "We got to the signal almost 3 years ago, and then went to Duna, Jool..."

Well between the Rivalry of Kip & Jeb there seems to still be enough hate to go around. Welcome Kefarious to the world of rocketry and Space Profiteering.  I Mean theres IS only so much Space at go around, Right?


Visible from the Bushes we can see 16 Thumpers kick off in a somewhat slow ascent.  "Why does it takes so much more thrust to send a probe than a Kerbal?"
Kezikiah Kermon "Because a Kerbal can walk if they miss the LZ."



An just in is streaming video of the Arc Lite Lander Probe Series Lander at the Munar Arch..." are we sure it isnt some sound studio in the desert? How did they get the craft in the Frame?"
Static >>>>

Edited January 23 by Fizzlebop Smith
Link

Tier 1 - WMCC (Stock Parts)

   Kefarious Enterprises has decided to abandon the completely remote approach, but apparently only with regard to atmospheric flight.  Kerbal News Right Then is brining you pictures of the brand new Skram Kan or "Datuh Wing" as it is reportedly called internally.

 

  With the addition of the UR-3 Skram Kan to their arsenal, Director Kezikiah is poised to take advantage of the advertisement opportunities now abandoned by the other agencies, apparently too big to do lowly PR work. So now another agency enters the realm of Kerballese Icon. We should see pictures of the Skram Kan perched atop (Due to a Crash the Picture was removed from Circulation) Kappy Rock on boxes of Kappy Krunch sometime next week.

  All this publicity should add a nice bit of Ker-Bling to their operating budget and keep Kerfarious on the world stage a little while longer. During the press conference earlier today, Director Kexikiah seems kept dodging the questions about launching  42 separate payloads for 'unnamed' parties by turning attention to the new Skram Kan.


"Kerfarious Enterprises does not seek to expdand its kerballed program into the reaches of space, but instead are seeking to obtain first hand Datuhz from all over Kerbin" Kerbal News Right Then has heard reports of field operative for Kerfarious enterprises looking up and talking into little black boxes "can you here me now?"

While sporting speeds well under those designed by United Rocket or Consolidate Kerbal States, but it seems the client list of shady entities wanting stuff flown all over Kerbin are long enough to keep Director Kezikiah churning out vessels and 'training' pilots.
